We were told we'd be able to move to the table at a later time which was fine at the time because we were waiting for a few others in our party. 4 or 5 pitchers of beer later, we decided to just stay put at the table, and the waitress accommodated us (added new table) as best she could. Nice that bought us a pitcher for our troubles. 

As some of the other reviews have mentioned, the pizza is not the best, but definitely solid with the crispy crust leading the way. We ordered the Eagle Special and Amy "E," which we were later told are the best off the menu. The Eagle Special is your typical combination with peperoni, sausage, mushrooms, bell peppers, green onions and olives. The Amy "E" is simpler with sausage, white onions, mushrooms and jalapenos. I love heat, so this was favorite...simple flavors, and nothing competing each other. 

Go to Eagle Pizzeria for the excellent service, and the Amy "E"...will not disappoint.
author: Marie B.

description:
We first went to this pizza place immediately following a birthday party.  We were excited to see that there were toys accessible for all of the little ones to play with.  My husband and I weren't sure if we would return, but thought we should give it a shot.  Luckily, we arrived long before a post sporting event of 30 arrived.  My daughters were occupied with the play kitchens and it was refreshing to know that there were lots of kids there, so I didn't feel too bad when my youngest started to whine.

The owner is extremely friendly.  The pizza was absolutely delicious, and their tomato/cream sauce sure is tasty.  We used to go to Pirro's for our family pizza nights, but it was so not clean and kid friendly.  We are excited that we have another kid-friendly restaurant so close to our home.
author: Karen C.

description:
Not the best pizza I've had in town - but then again, SF is definitely NOT a pizza town.  Service was great, pizza was so so.

The dining room was fun with a sports theme.  And it does have a definite local joint feel to it.  

But perhaps the best part of my recent visit was when the cute young guy with the cap and curly black hair seemed to flirt with me... me?  mmm mm now THAT'S tasty!
author: Jim S.

description:
I've been to this place a few times, and it's the ONLY pizza place I want to sit at and eat, they do deliver too though. It's kid friendly and being a parent, what's not to like about that!? They even have a toy corner so the kids can go play, after wolfing down their food, so you don't feel rushed. They have Art done by the owners and patrons kids on the walls, as well as an entire wall for San Francisco Sports fans. And the big screen TV is usually set to one of the many games. 

My daughter and I shared a chef salad and small pizza, it's was so good we had to walk home to work some of it off, lol... I love the way they take the sauce and cheese up on to the crust, I'm not a fan of dry crust, blah. The staff is also so friendly it's a FUN place to go out for pizza and I tend to think "fun" rather then "hip or trendy" when i think pizza, I also tend to think BEER! Boy do they have a selection of beer, almost a flavor for everyone, they also have wine, juice and soda available too. 

If you've got a kid or are just looking for a FUN place to have a slice, and a beer,  besides the comfort of your own home, give this spot a try I'm sure you'll enjoy the friendly service, and delicious food.  And if you feel like staying in they also deliver!
author: Ariona E.

description:
I first smell the pie for a few minutes, taking in puffs of tangy sauce, the yeast of the dough and the sweet mozzarella. Then, I take a sip of one of their microbrews while visually admiring the pizza. From there it is a blur....a carbo-licious faint memory. 

If in the mood to get out, we will eat there, starting with a salad. However, most of time we have it delivered on a lazy Sunday afternoon while watching a Warriors game.  There are plenty of other pizza spots that deliver in our neighborhood - but Ken & Amy's is our choice.
author: Amy E.

description:
Never eaten there, always got delivery.

B+ pizza, A+ service, so would be 4 stars. Except that they (a) know beer, and (b) deliver beer to your door at midnight at very reasonable prices, which brings them back up to 5 in my book (or 6 if it were possible).
author: Uncle F.

description:
Very good pizza, and the folks who run Eagle are VERY nice and very friendly.  They work their butts off but are always pleasant.

The pizza is my favorite in the Parkside.  As others have mentioned, the crust is notable.

I wish they opened earlier on Sundays, so I could gorge myself on a pie while watching the 49ers suck.
author: David P.

description:
I come here everytime our group finishes a show ! we come here to celebrate. And first of all the service here IS GREAT ! One time when we came around like 10 pm It was about to close. But the owner still took his time out to actually re-open the store for us to eat in . I thought that was wonderful. And the pizza here is great. many varieties of toppings to choose from and they are all not expensive at all ! all i can say is great place ! 

The bad new is just tiny. The atmosphere was kind of dark. i personally like eating in a well lighted place. but thats about it.
author: Andrew H.

description:
a group i help out with holds their meetings here.

came in and didn't expect to eat...just talk about what we were gonna do with a fund raiser then leave. 

i tried one slice and i loved it.  i can't say its better than my favorite places which I DO NOT GIVE POINTS FOR BEING CLOSE BY though i should.

this place was just very tasty and i ended up ordering two pizzas to go so i could be sure how much i liked it.

to be sure how much you like a pizza...bring it home...let it get cold and eat it after an hour or more.  if it STILL TASTES GREAT!  ITS A GREAT PIZZA!  

this place is good and i'm a fan.

If you want GREAT PIZZA you'll have to look at the other places i've listed as TO LIVE FOR!  those two places are totally different too.
author: Bing D.

description:
I find myself passing out stars based mostly on the experience I had somewhere rather than the actual product (in this case food). This place feels good when you walk in. I immediately figured out it was a family owned restaurant. The walls are covered in childrens drawings and sports memorabilia from many different decades of bay area teams. The baby chairs are ones you would buy at any baby store and not those ones that are wooden and look very unwelcoming for a little kid. I appreciated that little touch. It made me feel as though I was in someones house rather than a restaurant. The server, and I presume the owner, sat at our table and took our order. No problems at all with the service. Everything was well done on that front. 

Now to the food. We didnt get pizza, which I feel is a little unfair for Eagle's because the food we got might not be the best representation of their menu. Most people rave for their pizza and we didnt get it, but the food we did get was pretty good. I got chicken parmigiana(sp?) and my buddy got penne alfredo with chicken. Mine was good. Needless to say I ate all of it, but it was nothing set apart from all the other times I have had this dish. Eagle pizza gets four stars, well done, I will be back to try your pizza.
author: Ben H.

description: The beer selection was immaculate!  We couldn't believe how great it was to have people care about beer like my husband and I do!  :)  Oh, and the food was great, too.  We had the margherita pizza, which they just added to the menu.  The price of the pizza was great, as was the fresh basil, and crust.  The ambience was really cool--old sports memorabilia & framed "art" drawn by little kids.  What we liked the most, however, was how kid friendly they are.  There is a nice changing table with diapers and wipes, and tons of highchairs available.  The owners took the time to come and talk to us and tell us how cute our daughter was.  It was overall a really fun experience and we were really glad we stumbled across it.  We will definitely go back!
author: Melissa L.

description: Excellent pizza, not those franchise places.  Excellent services. Great for large party.
author: Dee B.

description:
When I walked in here I couldn't decide if this place wanted to be someone's living room or a restaurant. It could go either way.

On a Saturday night the dining area was mostly empty. I approached the counter area and observed a young man in the kitchen happily sticking his fingers into a pizza from the oven, tasting it, then moving on to another pizza, again deeply shoving his fingers into this pizza as well, before catching me in the corner of his eye only then stopping mid-lick. Disgusting.

I was hungry and not familiar with the area, so I decided to order a pasta dish anyway. A woman served with me with what could only be described as a surprised look on her face- sheer bewilderment that I was there at all, I suppose. I ordered a Spaghetti and Meatball dish, which she returned with in a few short minutes. It was a large plate of food and it resembled something between what I remembered from a school cafeteria and about how I would imagine prison food tasting- bland, uninspired and damp. Think watery tomato ketchup. The pasta was a disgrace- horrible. Come on people, look up a recipe on the internet.

Haven't tasted the "Finger lickin" good pizza. I'll leave those reviews to the others.
author: Stefan Y.

description:
Great service from Ken and Amy.  Family-oriented atmosphere with kids running around, etc.  Great for sports-teams, etc.

I actually don't like their cheese, but their bread is very fluffy.  

I MUCH prefer these guys over Seniores or Fing North Beach.  Bleh!
author: Dong T.

description: Pizza was really good, and staff was very understanding and courteous when I mixed up the delivery times. The cheese, pepperoni and greek were all delicious, thick crust and great flavor.
author: Julia K.

description: I owe it to Ken and Amy to write a review for Eagle. I don't understand how anyone can rate this place anything but 5 stars. Since the first day I stepped foot in this restaurant, the staff offered a warm and welcoming atmosphere. They also have a big flat screen TV if you ever wanna go somewhere to watch the game. As for their pizza, eagle is one of my favorites in SF and easily the best pizza on the west side of town. They make their own crust and always use fresh ingredients. I've never seen any grease on any of their pizzas and I'm willing to pay a little extra for this kind of quality. Eagle is a must for any pizza lover in the sunset! You will not be disappointed!
author: Joe N.

description:
After 3 years of trying to find a freakin pizza place other than Pizza Hut and Round Table, we have found one!!!!!!!!  I picked up the pizza and yes, it is not a gourmet pizza place or an upscale restaurant.  It is a totally local owned, operated and loved place.  Yes it has a sports bar theme.  Yes there are toys for kids to play with. But yet I am NOT A BREEDER (see other reviews) and I like this place!!!!!!  

Hubby to be ordered a pizza with veggies and I had cheese-less (yes they make cheese-less  pizzas and don't look at you weird) with veggies.  The crust was crispy (not hard) and thick but not like eating a loaf of bread.  

While I am typically a big fan of was producing, huge chain food, I do appreciate local businesses as well.  However, I have a beef with people who complain about chains and then complain that something is "too local" or "low brow" or what have you.  Guess what people?  A place like this is about as local as you can get.  Get off your damn soapbox and I'll get off mine too and I will treat you to a slice of Eagle Pizza.
author: Lauren R.

description:
Best damn pizza and service I've ever had since moving to San Francisco.

Had I never moved to the Outer Sunset, I might not have discovered this glorious pizza shop.  The owner is just an awesome guy who always remembers me and treats me with respect.

What is 5-Star worthy of Eagle Pizzeria is that I called one night, around 10:15pm (they closed at 10) and asked about ordering a pizza.  They recognized who I was as a customer and the owner himself cooked and delivered my pizza by 10:35pm (granted, I do live about 10 blocks away).  He proceeded to thank me for the business upon delivery of my deliciously hot pizza and told me I was a good customer and he was glad to help me out.  I was starved too so this was quite a way to solidify a customer.

I've tried Nizario's, I've been reduced to Seniore's, and then I was blessed by Eagle Pizzeria.

Don't get me wrong though, the aforementioned pizza places still definitely rock way more than your regular Domino's or Pizza Hut.

Thanks Eagle!
author: James G.

description:
If you love pizza, sports, and extremely friendly service, Eagle Pizzeria is THE place to go!

The owners are some of the nicest people you'll ever meet in life! Ken is usually my server and he's always fun to talk to. He's so laid back and will talk to you about sports, family, occupation, etc. 

On all four walls, you'll find sports memorabilia. The restaurant is full of autographed jerseys from the 49ers, old photos of the Giants, etc. It's a real joy to look at while waiting for your food. There is also a television that's always playing a Giants game if they are playing that day. 

Another great thing about Eagle is their wide selection of beers on tap and bottled. My dad and my brother love trying new kinds of beer, so this was a good place for that. Ken made a bunch of recommendations and we were quite pleased. 

Aside from the pizza being really good, it's just a great place to go with yoru friends, family, sports team, etc.
author: Allan M.

description: Came here for dinner after work last night and it was awesome. The people who run the pizzeria are all very nice. We got a thin pepperoni and it was fantastic. I didn't feel all stuffed and crappy feeling afterwards. The prices are very good compared to other places in SF.
author: Darius A.

description:
The only thing I liked about this place was their chicken parmesan sandwich.

Not only are they over priced, but for being not too far from me their delivery time sucked. They took forever.  I almost didn't want to tip.  But being a past delivery driver myself I could never do that.

Get your act together
author: Chelsea C.

description:
Came here and every time I've walked in, they've screwed up my order. I must have the "let's screw with this person" look on my forehead. However, my friends like it, so I can't bitch about it being crappy. 

The pizza is good, I like the stuff a lot, but order something like Lasagna, and the quality dips a little south. Once I ordered a meat lasagna, and they gave me a vegetable lasagna instead. So how did they rectify this? By just pouring some meat sauce over my lasagna, and then reheating it. Great. So it comes out messy, and crappy. Whatever... everyone needs to save money during the recession. 

However, it is a really nice place to go eat, and like every reviewer has said, there's sports memorabilia everywhere. 

But don't make me order. They'll probably screw it up again.
author: Clinton L.

description:
I don't get why everyone likes this place so much. For me, there are 3 classes of pizza in my life: delicious pizza, mediocre pizza and sh*tty pizza. I classify this as close to the sh*ttier side. Don't get me wrong, the service is a plus but the way the pizza's made along with the ingredients involved..oh man I won't go there. 

Just cuz most kids go to lincoln high school and its one of the closest pizza places, everyone from lincoln or in that vicinity goes there to eat. The  toppings were eh..everything slid off my slice before it got to my mouth. The sauce wasn't evenly placed on the pizza and in hawaiian pizza, you add ham. where was the ham?! Well whatever, despite the price, my friend and i ate there just to try it out. we ended up delivering the rest of it to his dog n went to Milano's on 9th n Irving instead. Just cuz its open late and is crowded with highschool hooligans doesn't mean its a really good place. That's my take.
author: Jason C. J.

description:
Pizza was very good. We ordered delivery and it arrived very quickly. The dough is nice fresh and the toppings good as well. A little pricey, but worth it since we were hella hungry.

Overall, I'd say this is the best place to get pizza in the Sunset district.
author: Hart B.

description:
This place gets an extra star for being able to accommodate large groups. This pizza was decent. Nothing super crazy special but I would definitely come back again. There really wasn't anyone in the restaurant on the Saturday morning when we went so service kicked bootay. He (I'm assuming the owner) was on top of everything. We also had salad and wings which were a bit too spicy for my weak ass. 

Overall a good place with a decent selection of beer and a good pizza.
author: Alia D.

description:
3 1/2 stars... It feels like you're hanging out at your friend's basement playroom. It has a very home-like vibe. There's sports memorabilia, family photos, and children's drawings on the wall. Plus, there's carpet...when's the last time you saw carpet at a pizzeria? Very kid friendly.

The pizza crust is light and very, very, very crispy.  Because of this, you eat more slices than you're use to. If there ever was a "healthy" pizza, this is it.
author: Ezduzit S.

description: The pizza could not have been better.  UFC on the tv was a nice touch.  More than enough room for the small group of seven I was in on a Saturday night.  The place is clean and well kept by a friendly staff.  Wide beer selection too.
author: andrew l.

description:
Haven't ate here in awhile so my review is based on past experiences many years back.  I always remember that this was one of my favorite pizza joints.  The reason was that their crust was extermely crispy and memorable for me.  

And for me growing up, I was always a non-crust eater until I came here and said, "Damn, I ain't wasting this crust! It's Damn Good"  

So not sure how good they are now, but I will certainly come back here at some point and judge it for myself.
author: Mark W.

description:
Ah memories of "Sports Bars" in the frumpy Midwest...the big screen TV's, the thick cigarette smoke, the "Red Wings" flag above the pool tables...

Wait! I live in California now, so why do I suddenly feel like I'm back in the Midwest?
'Cause the interior designer of Eagle Pizzeria must have hailed straight from the "classy" rust belt. I found myself momentarily searching for snowmobiles parked outside...
I left the Midwest for many reasons, one of them being the complete lack of aesthetic appeal ANYWHERE. So walking into Eagle was needless to say, slightly nostalgic. Not necessarily in a good way. 
Pizza was decent. 
There is GREAT pizza (little star) and then there is decent pizza. (eagle) Give me a good cold beer(s) and some conversation and decent pizza can suddenly become pretty ok. 
Service was excellent. Friendly and efficient. 
It's just down the street from me, but would I go back? Maybe, but only if they gut the interior. I just hate sports memorabilia, like with a passion.
author: D H.

description: The best pizza in town. The owners are great and take pride in preparing the pizza and serving it. Great place!
author: Marina N.

description:
Really good pizza place at a reasonable price.  Their seafood pizza is good but so are all the others. Awesome family place. If you have little ones, this is a great place to go. It's just a great family place, the family that runs the place is really nice too. 


They have an awesome bottled beer selection at a great price. I had that Alaskan Smoked Porter for less what I paid from BevMo.
author: Will U.

description: Bf was referred to this restaurant by one of his liquor representatives. We were in the neighborhood visiting, so we decided to have dinner here. Inside has a nice, home-y/comfortable feel. It is self-sitting service, so we sat at a table near the window. One of the workers brought us a couple menus. First off, the service was wonderful. The gentleman was very friendly and always made sure to check on us when he was coming our way. To order, you have to go up to the counter and wait for the food to be delivered to you. We had a short wait time...roughly 15-20 minutes. We ordered the gnocci and a medium pizza to share. By the way, their medium pizza was bigger than what we expected. I wasn't a fan of the gnocci, but I didn't mind it. However, I don't think it was home-made. Anyway, I'm not too big of a food snob. The pizza was good. I would definitely come back for the pizza. It was rather dough-y, but I enjoyed it. Additionally, I appreciate that it is a family-owned restaurant. It's something that I admire, especially in SF. When I come back, I'll be trying other items on their pasta menu.
author: Marie T.

description: Eagle Pizza is a great place for the family.  The environment is warm and inviting, and very Sunset.  The caesar salad had yummy dressing, and the lettuce was fresh.  The vegetarian pizza had a nice array of fresh veggies, including tomato, bell pepper, olives, and mushrooms.  I love the dough - it's really fluffy, but still has a crunch.  The service is very friendly.  I used to go here all the time in elementary school for victory dinners after volleyball, basketball, or soccer -- and it hasn't changed a bit (in the good way).
author: Ashley S.

description: Meat ravioli with sundried tomatoe sauce was best pasta I've had.
author: Katherine O.

description:
I will never return. But let's start out with the OK bits. The wine was fine. The beer was reasonably priced and there was a wide selection. The owner seemed nice and did ask us if anything was wrong when she saw our faces and how we were not eating...but the food was not something I would pay for. Even if it were free, unless I was really, really hungry, I wouldn't want to eat it. However, it didn't make us sick. 

Greek salad: Not awful, but the lettuce was strangely much too cold. The olives were kalamata, and yet seemed not as fresh as they should be...they were too soft and had a gross texture. The dressing didn't seem right, either. 

Buffalo wings: Really small, almost shriveled. My friend wouldn't eat a whole wing. 

Pizza: Yuck. I guess you could say "crisp" crust, but I think of it more as hard. 

The dining area is weird; on the night we went, no one else was there, but this girl (the owner's daughter?) was watching American Idol, turned up pretty loud. 

Maybe I could see going there if you had kids and desperately wanted someone else to cook for you? Maybe? But for us, no. We actually left and ate across the street at the Japanese place.
author: Lainunu J.

description: This is a review for a place that I used to live down the street from back in the late 90's so maybe it's different now but I am giving it 5 stars because every Thursday I used to stop in and get the special Meatball Sandwich.  It was to die for and I had that Meatball monkey on my back for the entire time I lived in SF.  I hope they still make that sammy so when I return I can OD on them....
author: chuck p.

description: I have been on a gluten-free diet since August and I am trying to learn to navigate my way through the world of eating out.  Eagle Pizzeria was the best gluten-free pizza I have had yet, and to top it off I got to enjoy a gluten-free beer with my meal!  I was very impressed with the owner's personal knowledge and friendly nature.  I would absolutely recommend this to Celiacs and those with a gluten intolerence.
author: Melanie G.

description: I should've asked the owner the story behind the name, reason to go back. Thank God for artichokes and my two nephews, who lead me to this pizzeria. Opening the door, if you're a San Franciscan from the 80s, you'd be glad you didn't have your pizza delivered. Why? They have pictures don't they, on this website. Well I'll be, Going to this spot more often. The owner bought me a beer, $3.50 for a quickie mug, smart man. 6 beers on tap, and an entire cooler with not your typical selection of pizzeria beer. Put a label on it, there were about 31 bottled beers to choose from. Larry called the 64 inch widescreen Tv, and there was a baby one hanging above the bar. Pizzeria/80s Niners Nostalgia/Topps Card Collector/Chidrens Art Gala. The owner was bullshitting me, like I'm bullshitting you. But he provided the best bull-shitting, to get another bullshitter to wanna come back for some more bull shit. It must be the pizza that has me talking like this. The owner, sweet guy, no sugar coating. Going in there with a monkey on my shoulder, he made me feel like I should've left the damn monkey in the car. Conversation was a conversation, real talk. How was the pizza? Ask Larry.
author: Cindy O.

description: Eagle Pizza is the best pizza in the sunset and has a great family friendly atmosphere.  Ken and Amy are terrific owners.
author: Justin H.

description: A friend and I went to this pizzeria this evening. Granted the Giants were playing Game 2 of the World Series and the place was not that busy. The game was on the TV and the owner? paid more attention to the game than to us. It took a while for the pizza to be delivered and it was mediocre at best. There was an odd smell in the air. It actually smelled like a wet dog but my friend said it may be the smell from the cheese. The table clothes were still dirty and I did not want to use the utensils. I had to request the check two times. Even though this pizzeria is within my neighborhood, I probably would not recommend it.
author: John M.

description: Pizza was pretty lackluster...I have to agree with the other helpers about the cheese. It just kinda slides off. Maybe they need to get better quality mozzarella. Very family friendly though.
author: Camille B.

description: Best pizza in city.  My favorite is the sausage and bell pepper on thin crust.  Owners, Ken and Amy, are awesome.  I order whenever I am in the mood for pizza and have most of my group kids parties there as well.
author: SF D.

description:
A friend and I went in for lunch one day. Nobody was there when we walked in. We just sat down and looked through a menu. I wanted pizza, but my friend is vegetarian and wanted a salad. 

Worst salad she's ever had, but my pizza was very yummy. Probably not going to go back.
author: Elizabeth Z.

description:
If you have kids and you like to eat good pizza and you want to enjoy a relaxing meal out, Ken and Amy's is the place to go.
The Eagle is also a perfect choice for sports gatherings, kid's parties, delivery for school events, etc.
And we love Ken and Amy.
Also - the antipasto salad is darn fine.
author: Nick S.

description: Ken and Amy are extremely friendly owners who run a comfortable, family friendly pizza joint.  Our sports teams often go there for our end of the season pizza parties.  Ken is always very accommodating when 30 plus of our kids, siblings and parents invade the place.  The pizza is good, and they have good beer on tap.  They are kid friendly for sure.  We recommend it.
author: Rachelle C.

description: the crust was great! this pizza joint has a great atmosphere with sports memorabilia on the walls, mostly giants and niners, and the service was great. the owners were very friendly!
author: Briana H.

description: Eagles Pizza is just down-home chilla  good when it comes to homey pizza. Sometimes you need to pick your spots to make sure you don't get caught in the team gathering vacuums but Kenny & Amy do their best and I keep coming back and the micro  brewski  hit the spot. These guys are the real deal.
author: michael d.

description: It's probably safe to say I am in love with eagle!!!!! Ive been going there since before ken and Amy owned the joint and it has always been the most amazing pizza ever! It' got a def. home vibe to it and they always greet you with a smile. Have any special requests (like more meet then lettuce on the salad) and they are more then happy to accommodate you. I think what makes this place so great is that its a local joint with local folks who still believe it's okay for kids to be kids and who support local sports teams. Its everything you would want in a neighborhood pizza place including amazing pizza. Try the BBQ chicken and red onion thick crust style..YUMMY
author: Jessica L.

description: Really great Pizza, fantasitc crust as others have noted.  Also I appreciate the hard work - once I called early to place a delivery order and the delivery guy hadn't started yet.  One of the owners brought my pizza over themselves.  Great local environment, their kids and others hanging around as they work the business the right way.  If you have one in the Sunset, you should bring your softball team here!
author: .Hazel T.

description: I would have to say that this place is more for larger families or parties. Not to say that this place is bad because of my somewhat low rating, but more to the fact that it's hard to have good company around when tons of kids are running around. Coming here back in high school I guess I didn't really notice it but after I have tried coming here twice within the past few months both of my experiences were the same. The food itself was good, the service exceptional. The decor was nice and the place had a good vibe. Waiting for longer periods of time while larger parties await simply sucks. Outside of that you need to find a time where there aren't too many kids around and order yourself a nice beer and have a wonderful conversation with the owners/workers. They are great people with great attitudes. It's always a pleasure trying to get to know new and interesting people.
author: Jason Y.

description: The pizza is pretty good. It is definetly what I would call standard american style...same as dominos in style, but with a much better sauce and overall tastier. That said, I frankly prefer a thinner crust, even if this is about as well as this type crust can be made. The sauce is very tasty with a lot of oregano.
author: Stephen W.

description: By far my favorite place for pizza here in the city!! It's like CHEERS bar only for food!!! My family and I have been going there since the original owners were there and I have to say It gets even yummier over the years. Ken and Amy are awesome and everything is so warm and fuzzy in there.....Whether you are out with your girl (like we so often are), out with the guys to watch a game and toss back a few or out with mom n dad you will feel like you've just come home again. Ken always makes me laugh and even though I am a picky eater he will always create something special for me that I can eat!! For many reasons, I LOVE THIS PLACE
author: Shaunna K.

description: I have been here twice now for the gluten-free pizza and I can definitely say that this place does it very, very well.  They use the same Still Riding GF pizza crust that Amici's does, but they seem to cook it to a more crispy and preferable texture.  They have a big selection of toppings, and the majority of them are GF (all except the BBQ chicken if I am remembering correctly).  The owners are friendly and attentive, and have been very accommodating to my dietary restrictions on both visits.  On the most recent visit, a mistake was made in the kitchen and they sent us out a free salad while they re-made the pizza.  The atmosphere is very homey and they have a great collection of sports memorabilia (Go Giants!) on the walls.  It seems like a popular place for parties and sports teams to eat.  In terms of the prices, GF pizza is not really cheap anywhere, but we have found the bill here to be a less than for a comparable pizza elsewhere.  I highly recommend this place for GF eating!
author: L C.

description: How do they get their pizza so crispy?!? How??? Really good pizza. Cute interior. I've been there when it's just been me and my friends and I've also been there when a couple tables over it was some little kid's birthday party. Comes with the territory and it's the price you pay for good pizza
author: Mark G.

description: I always order pizza from here. It is just really good. The crust is great. Yum!! Their pepperoni pizza or feta and sun dried tomato pizza are delicious!!! The only thing is the delivery takes quite a while.
author: O K.

description: The pizza is very good.  They make one of the better pizzas in San Francisco.  What makes their pizza so good is their dough and crust.  The people that work there are very friendly and welcoming.  I only wish they had more beer on tap, but their bottled selection is great.
author: Jung L.

description: 3.5 stars. A great neighborhood-family place that has lots of character. The owners are great and you can really tell they have a loyal following. Their food is home-cooking delicious. The lasagna is really good. The pizza is pretty good -good crust, tasty sauce, generous toppings- but there's not one particular thing that makes it unique. Red-checked tablecloths on wood tables add charm. They deliver but it can get backed up and be really slow.
author: B C.

description:
i give this place 4 stars overall.  the food here is pretty decent & my kids like it.  it personally is not my favorite pizza place but i dine here for my kids sake.  my wife & i do like their salad though, it is pretty good.  the service here however is superb, the staff is funny, friendly & will go above & beyond to make sure your eating experience is a good one.  the place is very kid friendly.  there is a large screen tv there to watch the game if you desire.  

overall, a great place to bring the family for pizza & an evening out.  usually, there is plenty of seating so waiting is never a problem.  the prices are pretty reasonable.  street parking is not too bad in this area.  plus 1 star for supporting our local neighborhood schools during fund raisers.
author: larry s.

description:
went there alone for lunch and didnt wanna scarf down a whole pizza even the 6" one and I was feeling a sub craving. So I tried their meatball sandwich.  It was so good I almost went pack just to tip the owner a dollar.  

The bread was nice and soft,(not the hard kind that scrape the roof of ya mouth like a window cleaner)  and the delicate meatballs were stuffed all over the sandwich.  Nom Nom. Best Meatball sandwich in Sunset that I know of.
author: Eric S.

description: The pizza here is well worth the visit to Eagle.  The crust is very good...light and crispy yet on the thicker side...just perfect!  The sauce is yummy with just enough kick.  They have a great variety of toppings although I enjoy immensely the five cheese pizza which is fab-o...very "gourmet" tasting!  The caesar salad was the BOMB!  The dressing was definitely homemade and the lettuce was fresh and crispy as were the croutons.  All in all it was a very pleasant experience.  I took away one star as I found it to be a little expensive.  We ordered one x-large pizza, a family size salad and four sodas...we had a coupon for half off the pizza and the bill was still over $50.00!  I would go back though, as I felt the quality WAS there.
author: Samantha M.

description: I like this place because they have excellent customer service, quality pizza and yes folks it's true, they do deliver beer!
author: Melissa B.

description: One of my favorite pizza places: I crave their pizza. I love the crunch in the crust: NO SOGGY CRUST HERE!!! (yuck!), the sauce is what gets me: its almost like a marinara, and the sausage is yummy: no frozen pizza sausage pellets here! their hot wings are the best when made by his wife but can be really dry when made by someone else, Ken is always ready to have a conversation, I usually pick up or get delivery, eating in the restaurant can get really busy: very family oriented, local childrens sports team celebration hangout, and really family owned that the floor staff consists of mainly Ken and/ or Amy: so service can be slow when there are big parties in there, but I love their pizza and am always down to support the local businesses: especially Ken and Amy's.
author: Jenniflava R.

description: When we having a craving for pizza, we alway call Eagle Pizzeria.   We like them because they are willing to make a wonderful half (veggie) and half (meat) pizza for us.
author: L C.

description:
if you're not one who has or appreciates children, stay clear.  this place not only welcomes them in, they provide an armoir full of toys and let the banshees run wild.

for those of us parents craving a place where we can sit longer than an hour waiting for our little time bombs to go off, this is your joint.

unassuming, good pizza, box wine (they have some decent stuff too) and great beer.  

and the owners run the place.  all in all, a great spot to have too much wine while the kids are totally entertained.
author: ellie s.

description: Hint...any pizza place that relies on 3-9 year old kid birthday parties for much of their business is not going to serve great pizza.
author: Todd K.

description: really nice and reallllly gooood foooood!!!
author: Jacob A.

description: This is the best pizza that I have ever had.  The sauce and crust are perfect.  The owners are the ones working there and they are friendly and efficient.  Yum!
author: Julie G.

description: Delicious! I LOVE this place, largely because of the family atmosphere.  The owners are sweet and the food is great - I have tried many pies here and haven't disliked any.
author: Jennifer U.

description: Wonderful pizza, besides being one of the few gluten-free ones in town (it's safe people, I've tried it many times), they use a great tomato sauce and very good mozzarella cheese. The choice of toppings in rather large. They also have a good selection of gluten free beer. The owner is very amicable and she likes to take personal care of her customers. She remembers faces and names, so when we go back it's like being with family. They have a very acceptable corkage fee ($8). It's a small quaint "neighborhood" style place. They also deliver rather far away in the city. It's definitely a thumbs up!!!
author: stefano f.

description: we got here at 3ish in the afternoon and the place was empty but i always seen people come in and out... the owner came up and us and greet us... we order the meat lover special and buffalo wings... after about 20 minutes the food finally arrives... we order a meat lover special, it doesn't look that much of a meat lover at all and them buffalo wings were dinky as in tiny... sometime you can't judge by how it looks right?! well here the taste... the crust was thick and hard, where the meat at?! taste like i just bite in a frozen pizza... as for the wings, these thing are tiny i must say... its smaller then wing stop... it taste old, like freezer burnt... no flavor of the chicken, just taste old in general... i only ate here once and i wouldn't come back here ever again... this place just look run down and no wonder them kids love this place cause they don't understand how real pizza and wings taste like... i wouldn't recommend this place anyone... i rather go round tables or domino...
author: JessePanda C.

description: Stepping in this place is like stepping into the 90s. You have Smash Mouth playing on the speaker system, an old school 200 pound 36 inch TV, and box of 91' Fleer Bubble gum pack baseball cards for purchase at the counter. The guy working there is nicer than your childhood nextdoor neighbor. Their pizza is pretty neat, clean, and solid. It has a nice crunch that allows the pizza to spring into your mouth... It has a lot of jump. So hop, skip or run to this pizza place and Get a Slice of the 90's.
author: Wats C.

description: While the menu choices aren't entirely creative for a pizzeria, the food is fabulous, and there's entertainment for younger children.
author: Jessica Z.

description: Okay, I thought pizza was pizza, but this pizza was super yummy. I had the vegetarian and the crust was so goooooooood. If you're out in the avenues, its definitely worth a try. I also understand the owners are big supporters of the local community hosting events in their space and making donations which I'm also all about. Go, Eagle's Pizzeria!
author: Caroline B.

description: My favorite pizza place. We've been ordering from here for more than a decade. Their crust is not too thin, not too thick - just right. They use good quality ingredients. Recently, they reduced the number of pepperoni slices on a pizza...but I still love their pizza. Note: It's a kid-friendly place so it gets pretty noisy and wild if you eat there.
author: Ruby T.

description: At long last, a great pizza on the west side. The crust is thin but not too thin, with a nice texture (kind of flaky and crunchy on the bottom). Good pizza sauce, flavorful but not overwhelming. I like the sausage 'za - not too greasy. I think they deliver or you can do take out, too.
author: Edie C.

description:
Hard to find good pizza in SF, but Eagle's certainly beats most of the competition I've tried. Cold beer, good salads, spicy buffalo wings, and decent pizza. Our tab was under $50 and included four beers.

The owner goes out of his way and he's very friendly. Saturday afternoon brought plenty of kids and I gather that's expected. Two TVs showing sports, plenty of sports memorabilia. I'll be going back.
author: John G.

description:
Gluten free pizza! Gluten free beer! Really nice people! Yay! All their toppings are also gluten free! Great news for us with Celiac Disease!

Pizza is scrumptious also, and the owners are your servers, could not be more friendly or helpful.
author: nicole v.

description: Micro Brew pizza! I don't know why I've ignored this place all these years. Perhaps because its across from our sushi place. Also, I, for some reason, always thought it was too bright inside. Anyway, thanks to Yelp reviewers, we finally tried it out, and I'm glad we did. I've only been here once, but the pizza was good. If you like fluffy crust and fresh toppings, which I do. It's sort of deep dish in quality, but not really. I'd compare it to the pizza you get at Milanos, but I'd give it a slight edge. They have Racer 5 and other micro brews such as Moylans and Marin Brewing  which gets them a huge bonus in my book. (They even have Chimay). Beer is an important ingredient for a pizza place. I wish they had more taps (3), but that's ok. The keg was acting funny that day and the girl gave me an unusually big head on my beer, but I brought it back and they fixed me up with no argument or attitude. In fact, the people are really nice and the customers seem to be regulars. We'll definitely be back. With the beer choice I'd give the place 4.5.
author: Rich M.

description: I remember back when Rocky and his wife used to own this place, he would get MAD at us if we didn't take that last 1/2 slice home!  Not wanting to refuse this offer nor mess with anyone named Rocky, we quickly learned to cooperate.  Simply stated, these guys make the best pizza anywhere west of Twin Peaks.  I often wonder how long the lines would be if this place were located on Chestnut or Valencia streets, but every time I've been there, the dining room was fairly empty -- well, no waiting for a table that way!  I *hate* soggy crust, and these guys have the crust thing workin'!  It's also very family-friendly: there are often dozens of kids running around, playing with crayons and other kids' paraphernalia, so if you're looking for a charming, romantic place for an evening soiree, you may want to look elsewhere.  But if really good pizza - plus a small selection of fresh, cold beers on tap - is your thing, don't even THINK about going anywhere else nearby.
author: Richard A.

description: Didn't know what to eat tonight so we yelped the surrounding restaurants.  Eagle Pizzeria popped up with 4 stars...hmm worth a try.  So we looked at the menu and decided on a pepperoni, artichoke hearts, mushroom pizza with olives on half of them.  Went to pick it up and noticed many sports memorabilia on the walls.  They also had old collectors sports cards for sale at the counter.  The owner, Ken, is quite friendly and converses with everyone.  Seems like they host a great deal of school sports teams parties from the nearby schools.  They also have a big selection of beers...oh, and milk for your kids!  20 minutes later the pizza was ready, brought it home and dug in.  It was pretty delicious.  The crust was our favorite.  It was quite crispy and everything else about it was great also!  One thing that I forgot about was to get some soda before I had left.  darn...anyways, Great tasting pizza...i'm sure we'll be back here next time we have pizza cravings.
author: LittleBird 8.

description: i'd rather have round table delivered or pick up a frischetta brickoven pizza.
author: Craig I.

description: Went here for the first time a few weeks ago. Decor is OK, more sports theme than anyting else but felt a little odd because the is also a bit of a daycare center feel to it.  I know this is a family owned place but I did not really feel comfortable having what I guess are the owners kids coloring on the next table and then having the child (maybe 10 years old) helping to run my credit card. The owner is very nice and did attend to us very well(Ken?).  Pizza was not bad and had a nice crispy crust. Toppings we OK but my son and I felt it was a bit bland.  Price is a bit high for pizza with the "everything" pie in an extra large 18" going for just under $30.  I think we will return fron time to time, but not the best we've ever had.
author: Stuff D.

description: Just came back from the best pizza I've had in a very long time. The combination of garlic, mushrooms and artichoke hearts was delicious, and the sauce was great!  Ken is really nice about accommodating to special needs.  My daughter asked for the ceasar salad with ranch dressing since she's a vegetarian, and Ken was happy to make it for her.  This is a wonderful family restaurant with friendly service and excellent food.
author: Flora K.

description: one of the ebst places, and is very gopod pizza, and very lirbal owers
author: Leigh McInnis Lee G.
